gravitate.domain.event.builders_new.build_ucsb_event(start_timestamp=None, end_timestamp=None, local_date_string=None)[source]¶
gravitate.domain.event.builders_new.create_time_offsets(local_time, later=False, offset_low_abs_sec: int = 7200, offset_high_abs_sec: int = 18000)[source]¶
This method creates a target with event start_time from Facebook dict.

The offsets represents how much in advance is user’s preferred earliest and latest.

Limitations:
this method won’t work if any datetime string represents a time when

daylight saving ends (November 4 1:00AM-2:00AM). since anytime in between corresponds to more than one possible UTC time.

Parameters

  • local_time –

  • offset_low_abs_sec – The offset with lower absolute value.

  • offset_high_abs_sec – The offset with higher absolute value.

Returns

find_by_date_str(date: str, category)[source]¶
Find airportEvent that has the matching “localDateString”. Note that this finds

only one event that fits the condition. If there are more in firestore, ValueError will be raised

Parameters

  • date – local date string eg. “2019-01-01”

  • category – “airport”

Raises

ValueError: only exactly 1 event can fit the condition in the database

Returns

one event that fits the condition

find_by_timestamp(timestamp, category)[source]¶
Description

This method finds an airportEvent that “overlaps” with the timestamp provided.

DEPRECATED

Parameters

timestamp – the point-in-time that the eventSchedule has to include.

Returns

static get_with_transaction(transaction: google.cloud.firestore_v1beta1.transaction.Transaction, eventRef: google.cloud.firestore_v1beta1.document.DocumentReference) → Type[gravitate.domain.event.models.Event][source]¶
Description

Note that this cannot take place if transaction already received write operations. “If a transaction is used and it already has write operations added, this method cannot be used (i.e. read-after-write is not allowed).”

:type transaction:Transaction: :param transaction:Transaction: firestore transaction :type eventRef:DocumentReference: :param eventRef:DocumentReference: firestore document reference of the event to get :raises: :rtype:

location¶
Note that this method is non-transactional. We are assuming that

Location objects are immutable and ready before the transaction.
